Author: nocturnal#2177
Content: hey guys what is the cost of creating a blockchain via komodo?

Author: nocturnal#2177
Content: and what level of technical skill is required?

Author: bubu#1031
Content: hello all

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: there is no fee to create a blockchain

Author: jl777c#5810
Content:
you would need to be able to issue command line calls like:
./komodod -ac_name=NOCTURNAL -ac_supply=1000000 -ac_reward=100000000

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: that allows to create chains without dPoW. to add dPoW there is an annual cost, but that is only needed after mainnet launch

Author: nocturnal#2177
Content: so what is the quality control?

Author: nocturnal#2177
Content: would it not end up like waves assets (90% scam)

Author: nocturnal#2177
Content: if thre is no barrier to entry i mean

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: ok, so you created your chain. who will use it or even know about it?

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: its not like there is anyway for anybody to know that you made a new chain

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: so it wont allow spammers to create a new chain and force everybody to see it

Author: nocturnal#2177
Content: well what people do with waves is create a ton of tokens for nothing, stick up a website and list them on exchanges

Author: nocturnal#2177
Content: then dump and run

Author: nocturnal#2177
Content: happens constantly

Author: nocturnal#2177
Content: seems like exact same thing can be done with komodo assets if there is no barrier to entry

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: who would buy a coin without any security? without dPoW a new chain will not be secure

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: it is a lot more effort to maintain a blockchain than a token, which requires no additional effort.

Author: nocturnal#2177
Content: noobs buy them buy the billions lol

Author: nille#9011
Content: hello everyone

Author: nocturnal#2177
Content: but at least there is some technica knowledge required, that is a small barrier to entry

Author: nocturnal#2177
Content: (maintaning)

Author: Edward#3177
Content: Hey all, this has probably been asked already, but will there be any incentives to hold or use KMD on BarterDEX or the mobile version beyond the 5.1% yearly rewards?

Author: Edward#3177
Content: Just thinking it would be nice to get more use of KMD in the ecosystem without being too much of a barrier to entry.

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: what incentive is there to hold BTC, LTC, or any other currency?

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: the idea of locking people in to pay high fees, that is very blockstream thinking

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: what it does is makes people look for alternatives, the more such fees, the more urgent the need to switch

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: KMD is the center of the ecosystem

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: the bigger the ecosystem, the more value KMD has

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: it does not have to be transactional

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: KMD is the natural trading pair for ecosystem coins

Author: Edward#3177
Content: Good points. Not demanding it be transactional though. Like just offering an incentive like what BNB does. That's at least an option.

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: by incentive, you mean paid incentive. where do these funds come from?

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: BNB has its value from the paid incentive. what happens to it the moment those incentives are gone?

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: is there any ecosystem around BNB coin?

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: KMD is getting more and more projects that are joining as it allows to jumpstart things and for much less effort to get a fully functioning and independent blockchain.

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: so because there is no payment required other than the nominal dPoW fees for notarization, there is really no reason not to build on komodo. which means a lot more projects will decide to do this

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: and if KMD gets just a small percentage of the overall ecosystems value, then this becomes a bigger and bigger value over time. like BTC is the center of a very large ecosystem and that gives it a lot of value, even though it doesnt even pay 5% APR.

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: so when KMD has a very large ecosystem and is paying 5%, then really, what more is needed

Author: Edward#3177
Content: All true. Patience is key here of course. Just brainstorming a bit outloud. Some incentives would help get KMD into a higher cmc ranking. Of course it would be good for speculators, but that ranking helps to show legitimacy for projects shopping for where to build.

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: we welcome all donations to help pay for such incentives

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: it is easy to spend other peoples money

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: but the reality is that the crypto industry is very expensive to even just get published press releases

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: everything costs 10x to 1000x more than it should

Author: nocturnal#2177
Content: and takes 1000x longer ðŸ˜‚

Author: Edward#3177
Content: Could there be some kind of friendly way to fund such a thing from the 5.1% yearly reward of top wallets. Like a scaling system or dare I say it, tax brackets. Shit I hate that I even think of such a thing, but it's worth working through a convo about.

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: so go and convince the top wallets to pay a tax

Author: nocturnal#2177
Content: or charge fees for blockchain creation

Author: nocturnal#2177
Content: would raise money and keep out scammers

Author: nocturnal#2177
Content: some scammers

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: the way the tech works, charging a KMD fee to create an independent chain would be totally artificial

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: it is open source, they can just fork it

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: people seem to forget this

Author: nocturnal#2177
Content: ah ok

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: if there is a zero cost option by forking, then having any cost is a barrier

Author: nocturnal#2177
Content: its all greek to me

Author: nocturnal#2177
Content: yes indeed

Author: nocturnal#2177
Content: no point

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: and putting up barriers to adoption during the "get as much adoption as you can phase" is backwards

Author: nocturnal#2177
Content: sure. waves tokens have become a bad joke tho

Author: Edward#3177
Content: For sure, they can fork code, but they can't fork the leadership. Just working through some thoughts. Thanks for addressing it.

Author: nocturnal#2177
Content: just saying

Author: nocturnal#2177
Content: good to avoid that somehow

Author: Alright#0419
Content: gatekeeping and independence do not work together

Author: nocturnal#2177
Content: so what is the benefit for a company to build on komodo rather than make there own chain?

Author: nocturnal#2177
Content: less technical knowledge is required?

Author: Alright#0419
Content: creating a BTC fork can take months

Author: Alright#0419
Content: creating an assetchain takes minutes

Author: Alright#0419
Content: maintaining a BTC fork can take a team of people

Author: nocturnal#2177
Content: time and expertise

Author: nocturnal#2177
Content: this is what makes a project legit

Author: Alright#0419
Content: maintaining a assetchain can take 0 people

Author: Alright#0419
Content: 0 people other than our notaries, devs and community

Author: Alright#0419
Content: but basically there can be very little maintenance needed on chain creator's part

Author: Alright#0419
Content: Assetchains are very modular, just pick and choose which features you like

Author: Alright#0419
Content: features that would otherwise take you months(if not years) to code in your own BTC fork

Author: nocturnal#2177
Content: sure ok

Author: nocturnal#2177
Content: so there is flexibility about what the blockchain can be used for

Author: nocturnal#2177
Content: other than just a monetary token

Author: nocturnal#2177
Content: (like waves tokens)

https://developers.komodoplatform.com/basic-docs/installations/asset-chain-parameters.html

A ridiculous amount of different customization features
